intro: Hieracium sertiflorum, commonly known as the clustered hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and it thrives in temperate climates. Its leaves are generally basal, with a rough texture, and its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Hieracium sertiflorum is often found in open habitats and can be an indicator of nutrient-rich soils.
